definition: the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself

sentences.english: Restore luster to the skin, the beauty parlor every week or self-massage time.
sentences.chinese: 令肌肤恢复光泽，每周可以到美容院或自行按摩一次。

sentences.english: Use Silky Skin Pouch-Removing Eye Protection Package in beauty parlor professional nursing.
sentences.chinese: 在美容院专业护理使用肤如凝脂消袋护眼套装。

sentences.english: Use Flower Time Multiple-Purpose Eye Protection Package in beauty parlor professional nursing.
sentences.chinese: 美容院专业护理使用花样年华多效护眼套装。

sentences.english: Manicure counters are a familiar sight in Singapore's ubiquitous shopping malls, which also boast at least one beauty salon each.
sentences.chinese: 美甲店和美容院在新加坡的各大商场中随处可以看见。

sentences.english: The station is almost opposite the school.
sentences.chinese: 这家餐厅的斜对面是一家美容院。

sentences.english: Go to beauty parlour nodding naevus to you can leave scar?
sentences.chinese: 去美容院点痔会不会留疤？

sentences.english: Innovation and change is the development direction of beauty salons.
sentences.chinese: 求新求变是目前美容院的发展方向。

sentences.english: B:At a new beauty parlor nearby.
sentences.chinese: 在附近新开的一家美容院做的。

sentences.english: Rehana works at a beauty parlour down the road.
sentences.chinese: 瑞哈娜在远一点的一家美容院打工。

sentences.english: It will be distributed, too, in women-run grocery stores and beauty parlours.
sentences.chinese: 由女性经营的杂货店和美容院中也会有该机器出售。

sentences.english: Whenever my girlfriend comes back from the salon, I always compliment her hair.
sentences.chinese: 我女友每次从美容院回来，我都会称赞她的头发。

sentences.english: I love going to the beauty salon because they really pamper me.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢去美容院，因为他们实在是对我很好。

sentences.english: The beauty salon is closed on the second Tuesday of every month.
sentences.chinese: 美容院每个月第二个星期二休业。

definition: to win honor/to put on a stern face/to have a facial (beauty treatment)
non-surgical cosmetic procedure (injection of Botox, hyaluronic acid etc)
abbr. for 微整形[wei1 zheng3 xing2]
to improve one's appearance (using cosmetics or cosmetic surgery)/to make oneself more attractive/to beautify
hairdressing/to give sb's hair a cut or other beauty treatment/beautiful hair
cupping glass/fire cupping (acupressure technique of Chinese medicine, with fired vacuum cup applied to the skin)/ventouse (vacuum method used in obstetrics)
